Discussion: Reviews
WRITING.TEXT: I thought this subreddit could do with some constructive discussion. Something to break up the usual stuff. So, for this week anyway, lets talk about how reviews should or could be done. Polygons latest review of Bayonetta 2 built up a lot of controversy due to it's low score compared to the majority of other reviewers. The main reason being the reviewer marking it down for having sexist themes and so on. The usual argument is that it's his opinion. I'd argue that the system in place on most sites makes that a tough point to push. The review system in most sites is score based. That score is then fed into Metacritic which, from we have seen, publishers take an interest in. One that stands out is Fallout New Vegas and the contract Obsidian had with the publisher. They had to reach a certain score on Metacritic to receive royalties. And they missed this mark by a single point. Another issue is that even though it's a single persons opinion, they are giving a game a score that the whole site backs. It's the score Polygon gave as far as the average person knows. And every reviewer has a different idea of what a review score means. One persons eight is another persons six. It just muddies the whole thing. When someone looks up review scores weeks or months after a games release, they aren't going to see the individuals opinion, they'll see a sites review. This is less of an issue for Youtubers. Like Angry Joe. He gives you a 20 to 30 minute review and then a score. But it's clearly his opinion and you can base your decision off of that. Personally, I'd like to see score just fade away. I get that they need a summary at the end so I'd just like to see a summary list of pros and cons. Then you can just base you decision on whether any of the pros or a cons would affect you decision to buy it. But that's just my opinion. I know a good few people who prefer review scores. If wanted to change the standard of how reviews are done, what would you change?

WRITING.TITLE: [Rebirth #1 Spoilers] Superman
WRITING.TEXT: So. I haven't really seen it brought up here and maybe there are leaks out about this already but, can we just talk about Post Superman for a minute. There was a bit of dialogue in Rebirth were this hooded character, Mr Oz, says that Post Supes and his family are not what they believe they are and neither was New 52 Supes. So mix that in with the knowledge that the New 52 universe is the Post-Crisis universe, just altered by a powerful force. Post Supes believes his universe was gone and that he and his family were refugees on a new universe, a new Earth. But this is his Earth, he, like Wally, weren't altered or changed due to Flashpoint and Dr M because they were outside of the universe/multiverse at the time. So if he is the Superman of this universe, what does that make New 52 Superman? Possibly a creation of Dr M to fill in the hole Post Supes created? Not saying New 52 Supes had any knowledge of that, just that Dr M needed a Superman for the Earth.

WRITING.TITLE: For those who still suffer from stuttering
WRITING.TEXT: Ok so I'm making this thread for every poor soul who has gone crazy searching for an answer for why this game stutters for them even on high end systems. You've tried everything from setting graphics to low, locking the framerate to 30fps, trying the special-k mod and every other tip and trick out there. I've done all of this, I've even changed from a 6600k with 16GB ram to an 8700k with 32GBs of ram and a fresh Win 10 install. I didn't upgrade specifically for FFXV but I was definitely interested in seeing if it would fix the stuttering/hitching. It didn't. I have a GTX 1080 btw. But I seem to have finally fixed my issue. All I did was went into my Nvidia Settings, Manage 3D settings, Program Settings where I selected FFXV and then changed Power Management Mode to "prefer maximum performance". I've been running around the Hammerhead area with zero stutters since. That's the first time since I've had the game. I'm presuming the other power options, Optimal and Adaptive, caused my GPU to fluctuate which caused the stutters. Now maybe this won't work for you, but if you're just googling for an answer and come across this post, give it a try.

WRITING.TITLE: DQXI Super Strong Monsters
WRITING.TEXT: So how much harder is Super Strong Monsters? I'm about to start the game but after looking around and seeing comments about how easy the game is I thought I might do Super Strong Monsters but then it seems to be that you eventually hit a wall at that difficulty. So the choice seems to be Very Easy or Very Hard. Anyone have real experience with **both** options? I'd try Super Strong but I'm worried I'll end up reverting to normal mode after it ramps up the difficulty too high and then I'm far too over leveled for normal. **Edit:** I've decided to go with *Reduced exp from easy fights* as a sort of middle ground between Regular and Super Strong Monsters and so far so good. It pretty much puts a halt to grinding Exp once you hit a certain level in areas and I don't feel like I'm trying to avoid battles in fear of over leveling. Plus I can grind for gold if I want without over leveling. It might be something I turn off in the later parts of the game but for now it balances things out nicely for me.

So nothing game breaking then? My biggest issue would be hitting a wall that I felt was completely unfair. How long do boss fights generally take? I don't mind grinding at all, been playing JRPGs long enough that it's weird not needing to grind.

I think the best middle ground might be the *Reduced exp from easy fights* option. As far as I can see, from what I've looked up anyway, it tends to keep you from over leveling if you like exploring. Still gives me a bit of a challenge on regular without being super frustrating.
I'd imagine having both on would be pure torture.

I've always found that Superior reads so much better now that it's finished and you can go from start to finish as the actual run felt dragged out and you're just waiting for Peters return. As a finished series it feels more like 1 big complete story, a beginning, middle and end with real character development. But, I ended up reading the bulk of Janes Thor in the space of a week and honestly, it felt kind of hollow in comparison. The bulk of it is just Jane reacting to Malekiths plots while building up to the actual War of the Realms once they got past the mystery of who Thor was. Overall it feels like, from the start of the War of the Realms arc, that it's Thor Odinsons story with Jane just stepped in while Aaron set up the pieces for the main event and then puts Odinson back into the spotlight. It wasn't really bad or anything but nothing really memorable except for Russell Dautermans art and the Shi'ar gods (really cool design). I'm looking forward to seeing what the MCU does with Janes Thor, that could end up being far more interesting and the idea of passing on a legacy makes more sense in the MCU when it's a given that certain characters will bow out permanently as actors move on.

Especially with Bungie. They really made their games back then for a specific platform with specific hardware. They squeezed as much as they could out of the 360. Even when the 360 had the feature to load whole games on to your HDD for faster load times, Bungie warned people not to do that with Halo 3 as it wasn't built with that in mind and would actually cause slower loading. Because they made the game to load off the disc in such a specific way. And Reach, from everything I've seen and heard, is far more complicated. I do not envy 343 trying to untangle all these unique *solutions* Bungie came up with for the 360. It's why I can't imagine MGS4 on the PS3 would ever get a port. That game was solely made for the PS3 and it's very unique hardware, I'd bet it would be an absolute nightmare to port to anything else.

WRITING.TITLE: Pa Kent asking the right questions (Superman: Villains)

WRITING.TEXT: DC seems to have an issue where they can't decide on the next generation. They either put them in the spotlight and build them up or they shelve them for no obvious reason. Seems to be DC Editorial constantly fighting each other on whether to keep the same status-quo of the last few decades that they grew up with or develop new interesting characters. Dick Grayson was always a fan favourite but he constantly has to deal with either being in the spotlight or getting absolutely shit on. Latest being the whole ["Ric"](https://i.pinimg.com/originals/c8/01/cb/c801cb874c3b71a1f8b2b24b465bd9df.jpg) stunt. Wally has had the same issue, getting completely wiped from continuity until reappearing in Rebirth which was met with huge positivity only to [destroy his character](https://insidepulse.com/wp-content/uploads/2019/09/Flash-Forward-1-spoilers-3.jpg) for a mediocre and forgettable story. And now Jon who was introduced in Rebirth, was a huge favourite and help enrich and develop the Superman story. Only for Bendis to shelve him, then age him up in a horrendous way ([imprisoned in a volcano for years by an evil version of his own dad](https://www.cosmicteams.com/legion/profiles/images/legion4/superman-v5-09.jpg)). And then send him to the future.

gt; Earth-3, which he never explained how it still exists. They tried explaining it in [Hell Arison](https://i.imgur.com/OFneqc8.png). Basically, the multiverse corrects or heals itself over time as it has a certain structure to it. So there'll always have to be an Earth 3, or a variation of it.
No doubt, I just found the explanation interesting, even if it had to be done by someone else because Bendis doesnt care. Bendis doing what Bendis does, which is whatever the fuck he wants.

I became a patient gamer not out of choice but time. When I finally had time to play a game it was probably already out for a few weeks. Then it would take me way longer than average to pass the game due to not having as much time. So when I finally get round to the next game on my list, it could have been out for a few months. It definitely has its pros. You'll have a game that should be polished after patches, the hype has died down so you have proper expectations so you're not as likely to be disappointed and you'll nearly always have another game to play right after you finish one. And it's cheaper. Usually.
I'm not crazy about the story since I felt like Batman Endgame had a similar set up but I'll read anything that Jorge Jimenez has worked on.
I hope it offers the option of a wider FOV than the PS4 does. I enjoyed what I played but it felt too zoomed in, probably for performance reasons.

Just to play devils advocate here since I think it might be a bit of a gray area in some cases and worth talking about. Say someone was made redundant say 2-3 weeks before the crisis. If it can be shown and proved that they had a chance at employment recently with businesses (interviews, etc) and that those businesses now have to close potentially causing that person to loose his or her chance at employment then I think a case *could* be made. Now I'm not going to say they should be automatically given the extra payment but I think it warrants a look at by a case by case basis. Not that I would think this is something someone who has been unemployed for a year should be qualified for. More like someone who was unfortunate enough to be let go or made redundant at the same time this all kicked off leaving them with little to no options in employment. Worth a thought anyway, it's a complicated situation to be honest and it's all fairly new territory for us.

Oh yeah it wouldn't be easy and any claims would be slow going. They'd likely have to set up a whole department to go over any claims. Probably best to limit those claims to those unemployed in the last 4 weeks max before the restrictions took place. Just found it worth bringing up.
Might as well call next year 2020 and rename this as the "off-year" or something.

I think it's worth at least considering for certain people at least. Worth a thought anyway, it's a complicated situation to be honest and it's all fairly new territory for us.

Well that's my job gone. Completely closing up shop over the next 2 weeks and that'll be it for good. To be honest I was already thinking of leaving, was burnt out and the owner wasn't listening to anyone, wasn't taking in any advice, just business as usual and focusing on little things rather than the big picture. It was like putting out a house fire by watering the garden plants. The writing was on the wall and this whole crisis just sped things up a few months. I'm fine though, got a pretty generous redundancy and savings that I've been building for a while and I'm debt free. That along with the #8364;350, I could go a solid year without work and not change my spending habits. Not that I would but at least I'm not stressing out about money like a lot of people right now. Plus the stress of the place has definitely been affecting me both mentally and physically. My stomach has been doing back flips, I had a constant headache from stress and anxiety and I've just been low on energy. That all pretty much washed away after the announcement. Gonna focus on me for a little bit, go binge my Netflix and game backlog, read a book or two, relax and then get myself in order.
I need a good routine. I love the gym but that's out the window now.

This week will be interesting. I know more than a few people who can't sit still for 5 minutes let alone two full weeks. Since the announcement on Thursday night there's been enough going on to distract everyone but now the real test of patience begins. By next week I'll be shocked if there aren't people who'll just break the "lockdown" rules because they can't stick it anymore. And I keep seeing on my facebook feed people arguing about how long this will really take, answers ranging all over the place. Some thinking we'll be in the pubs by Monday 13th after we *"kill off"* the virus to those thinking we'll be locked in our houses till December. Some of those arguments are getting heated too. Like, don't freak out about that stuff. I just look at what the HSE is saying. Which is, as of right now, that they're planning for a peak by 10th-14th but that they "do not know for sure when the peak would be". And that's it, no point in losing your mind studying charts or percentages trying to crack it, just have to be patient and wait it out.
I'm currently running outside and my god it's a lot harder than a treadmill ever was.
I suppose it's what you're used to too. It's like relearning how to run properly.

From Simon Harris when asked on the radio today if the restrictions will continue after Easter Sunday: #8220;*Will the measure be extended beyond Easter Sunday? I #8217;ve got to be truthful, I don #8217;t know. I think these measures are so restrictive and significant that you cannot leave them in place for a very long time.* #8220;*The judgement call our doctors had to make was, what is the right time to bring these measures in? So what we #8217;re planning to do is going intensively at this now for a couple of weeks so that when we get to Easter Sunday we can see some progress.* #8220;*Everything can #8217;t go back to normal #8211; it would be a complete fantasy to think that would happen. This virus will be with us for many months but is there some things we can lift on Easter Sunday? That is what we are all hoping.* #8221; I know too many people who imagine after these two weeks we'll just slip back into our normal lives over the next week or so. Like, I'm not saying don't be positive and optimistic but at the same thing you have to be realistic otherwise you're gonna find all this a lot harder to deal with long term.

For my own sanity I'm ignoring any predictions or stats I see online and just going by what the HSE says which, last I checked, was something along the lines of their planning for the peak around 10-14th April but that they don't know for sure. Or Leo yesterday saying: * #8220;What is likely to happen is that the number of new cases will continue to rise, we'll reach the peak - hopefully that will be in a few weeks time and not in a few months time - and the number of new cases will start to fall, and we'll reach the point where we can start to ease some of the restrictions, and then see what happens. #8221;* If the HSE and the government can't be sure, I doubt any lads on the internet are gonna suddenly crack it by staring at a few charts for days on end. Just gotta sit this out.
Same here. The first restriction to come in was of visiting Nursing Homes.

They dont seem to know themselves yet. Going by comments by the government, they'll evaluate the situation once we start getting near the end of the current lockdown. But we most likely wont be seeing things go back to normal anytime soon, just revisions and tweaks to the current restrictions. Hopefully loosening some restrictions in some cases. To quote Simon Harris yesterday: "Will the measure be extended beyond Easter Sunday? I #8217;ve got to be truthful, I don #8217;t know. I think these measures are so restrictive and significant that you cannot leave them in place for a very long time. #8220;The judgement call our doctors had to make was, what is the right time to bring these measures in? So what we #8217;re planning to do is going intensively at this now for a couple of weeks so that when we get to Easter Sunday we can see some progress. #8220;Everything can #8217;t go back to normal #8211; it would be a complete fantasy to think that would happen. This virus will be with us for many months but is there some things we can lift on Easter Sunday? That is what we are all hoping. #8221; Or Leo yesterday saying: #8220;What is likely to happen is that the number of new cases will continue to rise, we'll reach the peak - hopefully that will be in a few weeks time and not in a few months time - and the number of new cases will start to fall, and we'll reach the point where we can start to ease some of the restrictions, and then see what happens"

Some people have no sense at all. I only went to the local shop for bread, eggs and milk and I spent a solid 20-25 minutes waiting outside. Just because two pensioners would not stop chatting inside the shop and then spending forever digging through their purse for change, then deciding they want something else, then strolling over to get it, then deciding they want a lotto ticket and so on. Eventually the person behind the till just grabbed his stuff and "helped" put it in the car. But the pensioner just turns around to chat to the one behind her. Cashier has to tell them to move on. All the while some fella parks up, gets out and strolls up to the shop. Before he goes in I tell him to go back behind me and he gets thick, says he's only picking up milk and I tell him so am I but we all have to wait. So he decides to stand right behind me, I have to tell him to step back and he aint happy about that but does it. Then someone else comes along and tries the same thing, I tell him the same thing and he goes right next to the other fella and they chat away about how mad all this is and complaining about how long this lockdown is. Lads, there's a reason this is all in place and their the kind of people that cause this shit to go on longer than it might have had to if we had all just done what we where told. It aint rocket science. Jesus christ, I've a headache from just picking up some fucking milk.
I know someone who is 10 or 11 days waiting so far. So there's definitely a bit of a delay in results.

Seems to be a bit of a delay right now in tests. I'd guess we won't really see consistent daily numbers, we'll probably see some days with larger jumps in cases and then a drop the following day. I wouldn't focus too much on daily number of cases as an accurate assessment of how things are either improving or worsening for now. Going by RTE from the HSE: *The Health Service Executive earlier apologised to all those waiting for test results and said it wants to assure the public that it was making every effort to improve turnaround times.*

There's apparently a shortage at the moment. From RTE: "*Taoiseach Leo Varadkar has said there will be delays from time-to-time in testing for Covid-19 due to the global shortage of testing kits, reagents and other essential equipment.* *The Health Service Executive earlier apologised to all those waiting for test results and said it wants to assure the public that it was making every effort to improve turnaround times.* *The HSE said that, as indicated previously, laboratories were experiencing challenges in terms of securing supplies of reagent for testing.* *It said this is a global problem, with major suppliers having to ration supplies across the world.* *The HSE said it continues to prioritise testing of healthcare workers and patients in acute hospitals and residential facilities."* I wouldn't focus too much on daily number of cases as an accurate assessment of how things are right now either way. And it probably aint good for your own mental health to fixate on that anyway.

gt; And if its taking a week to process the tests are the numbers of confirmed today actually from last week? I've know someone who has been waiting well over a week for results. It seems to be a bit random so I doubt were seeing accurate results. Wouldn't shock me if tomorrows numbers are either well into the 300's or even lower than today. Until this shortage is sorted it's gonna be all over the place in results. I don't know about ICU or deaths, I haven't seen anything about how those are being included.

Well this just came up from Simon Coveney: *"I think people do need to realise that these restrictions may go on for some time," Mr Coveney told a briefing this morning.* *"We've set an initial period but I think it may well be that we will need to go beyond that initial deadline, but again that will be a decision take with the best public health advice."* [Link](https://www.rte.ie/news/coronavirus/2020/0402/1128025-government-launches-new-community-call-initiative/) And Simon Harris had a video on twitter yesterday going over some stuff including questions. Obviously one question was asking if the restrictions will be extended. To summarize it, his answer was basically: *We need to see how things go, the more progress we make the more likely it is that we can start to look at how we can ease those restrictions. No one wants to leave these restrictions but we have to do what we have to do to save lives.* If I had to take a guess, this will be extended until the end of April for now. Best outcome is restrictions are eased for that period but I doubt even they're sure yet.

Jesus, when I saw this I laughed, thinking sure it's only Wednesday. It's fucking Thursday, how did I manage that? Even now I can't figure out how I lost a whole day. And when typing this I had to double check.

Quick question, how is it? I've only played the Trails in the Sky series but loved that. It definitely scratched that JRPG itch I get sometimes. I've been waiting to play Cold Steel till after I could play The Crossbell series first. I know Zero just got a good fan translation but not sure if AO is getting the same treatment.

WRITING.TITLE: Any Router Recommendations?
WRITING.TEXT: So my Eir F2000 Router is starting to act up after a few years and I was looking at getting something a bit better. But I'm not sure if there's any compatibility issues with Eir Fibre. Anyone using something like a Netgear router or is there a compatibility list out there?
Do you know if the software side is any better on F3000? I find the F2000 pretty basic. I'll give it a shot anyway, if I can get a free replacement might as well try that first.

Some are definitely starting to crack. And as usual it's the loudest. Already someone on my Facebook feed who is constantly posting stuff like "stay strong" and pictures of doctors or nurses with angel wings and that shite, is now asking if their is a hairdresser available to call down to them. Also noticed at least 3 different businesses who have been closed as they're non-essential have the lights on today. Still closed to the public as far as I can see but still. Not sure why, maybe the owners or managers running in to grab stuff but it's a bit weird multiple different businesses doing this at once. We're not even a full week in to this "lockdown".

gt; I genuinely start to worry how many businesses will even be able to open again once the lock-down is over. This is me probably being overly optimistic but my hope is that when this finally comes to an end, we'll see a bounce back. People are going to want to go out, eat out, shop etc after having all that taken for so long. So while there'll no doubt be businesses that will struggle and close during these restrictions, there'll hopefully be room for new ones to take advantage of that new potential. And unlike last time, the government won't be bailing out the banks with billions of euro that ended up crippling us, that they'll support the local businesses and the average person affected by this so when the time comes we can hit the ground running. I know that's super optimistic and simplified but it's a hope I like to have.

Leo also didn't seem to be as keen as Coveney to say an extension is likely either. He probably doesn't want confirm anything like that until it's official and can make it somewhat digestible to the public. Though I can't see a world in where the Leaving Cert could go ahead as normal in such a short amount of time from now.

As bad as it can get here, I took a look over at Boards to see what they were saying. Some of those threads were interesting. Every sort of answer, from this will go on for a year to it will be fine by next week to suddenly *we should never had gone lockdown because it's just an excuse for all of us to go on the dole and #8364;350 is too much* and so on. It devolves rapidly from there. I might just buy Animal Crossing tomorrow and try to forget some of the stuff I read there.

Talked to the mother today, sounding pretty down about the whole thing. She's not someone to sit around much so the talk of an extension isn't helping her mood. Ordered her a few books from her favourite writer on Amazon that should get to her by next week as a surprise. Should perk here up a bit.
It seems to be pretty right wing by what I read. Haven't used boards in long, long time but curiosity got to me and I regretted checking pretty damn quick.

Oh she'll be fine, just had a rougher day than usual. We all have those days. She has the father doing up the garden too so they're plenty distracted. The grandmother is in a home which worries them but like I said to them, she's in one of the safer places in the whole country and she's as tough as nail anyway.

Yeah, honestly the government probably don't 100% know yet what the next step will be. They likely have different plans in place but it's gonna rely on the next few days on what one is gonna be used. If I had to guess, they'll make some kind of announcement on Thursday or Friday next week. It could be an extension of the lockdown by a week or to the end of the month or we could be lucky and it'll be loosening of some restrictions, be it travel distance, some non-essentials re-opening, etc. I doubt we'd be that lucky but we're all just figuring it out as we go. Either way, only believe what you read straight from the official source. If you see anything on whatsapp or anywhere that isn't the official source (including here), go to that source for real confirmation.

I got spoiled on the ending unfortunately. Or a piece of it, I don't really know. I don't have all the context but, aside from being annoyed at being spoiled, I am fine with what I heard. And I'm interested in how it will play out. But then I see others who are very negative about it. Some comments from people saying they've uninstalled the game, lost all faith in SE, ruined the whole series, etc. Bit overdramatic in my opinion. Also, the more positive impressions of the game seem to talk about the game as a whole, from gameplay, characters, overall story etc, while the more negative impressions tend to focus on just the ending spoiler. Honestly, I don't know if it's good or bad for sure because I don't have the full context to it and haven't played the game yet so I'll reserve judgement till then. Either way, it'll probably leave a divide in fans that's gonna lead to a lot of bitter arguments.
It's always around 6:30am-7am here.

I got spoiled on the ending unfortunately. Or a piece of it, I don't really know. I don't have all the context but, aside from being annoyed at being spoiled, I am fine with what I heard. And I'm interested in how it will play out. But then I see others who are very negative about it. That's how I got into JRPGs. My Dad saw the advertising for the game which was very action packed and lots of the FMVs. So he bought it and I remember watching him start the game, both of us amazed at the opening FMV and then the first battle starts. He was like what the fuck is this and turned it off. I was interested but never touched it until I was bored during the summer holidays, started it up since I played everything else and there was no going back, huge fan since.

There was a great moment somewhere in Spider-Man, I think after OMD, where Spidey stops robbers at a store. Before he can swing away, the owner gives Spidey a drink for free as thanks. He takes the drink, says thanks and while he drinks it they talk about how hot it is as there's a heatwave at the time and then he swings away. It was this small little moment but for some reason it stuck with me as it seemed so normal.

In terms of mental health during the the lockdown, I'm actually doing pretty good. It's one of those times were the internet has made a world of difference. We have all forms of media from shows to movies, books, games, music, etc that we have near instant access to. Plus being able to chat to people pretty easily online, through FB, Whatsapp, etc. Even able to video chat with the grandmother while shes under lockdown at the nursing home. Even being able to learn something new, be it a skill or language is easily available online. All this kind of stuff makes current life a whole lot more bearable than if this had happened pre-broadband. Now sure, I had plans for this year in terms of changes in my life from work to relationships only for this lockdown to put everything on hold. It's basically put everything on hold for the year, which causes anxiety at the idea I'm wasting a chunk of a year of my life, it's the same part of my brain that just randomly screams at me that I'm not doing enough because I decided to sit down for more than 10 minutes. Also, no amount of running hits the same itch I have for going to a proper gym, god I miss the gym. But then I just remind myself everyone is in the same boat and it's out of my hands. When the dust settles I'll hit the ground running but for now I'll do what I can.

Anyone else realising how much money they were wasting before the restrictions? I swear I must have been spending a small fortune on just breakfast and lunches a week that I now make myself at home. Or buying other random shite you see when you're out getting the thing you originally needed. I cant see myself going back to my old spending habits after all this is over after seeing what I can save.

gt; Blue line shows what it would look like if we had do nothing - If we took it as today, **the peak would be seen 20 days from now**, and would have almost 100,000 positive cases per day. gt; gt; Red line is the result of closing schools, universities and implementing basic social distancing -If we took it as today, **the peak would be seen 40 days from today**, but would still have an overwhelming peak of 60,000 cases. gt; gt; Current planning is that we don't want a peak. We want to flatten the curve to a straight line, so that what we currently see is the highest we will see, but will keep at that level for some time That's interesting. I remember when the early restrictions came in that a few people were presuming our peak would be in early to mid April based on Italys charts at the time. And that in the worst case we'd be seeing restrictions lifted by early May.

gt; Well, they said the peak would be 10-14th Is that the case anymore? During the briefing it was said that if we hadn't done anything the peak would have been 20 days from now. And that it would have been in 40 days from now if we had just closed schools, universities and implementing basic social distancing And now the current plan is to flatten the curve to a point were we won't even have a noticeable peak but that the current numbers will stay as is for quite a while.

They said we would have had a peak in 20 days from now if we hadn't done anything with 100,000 cases a day. And it would have been 40 days from now with around 60,000 cases a day if we had stuck to the first restrictions just before the lockdown. Now they're hoping that we won't have a real peak, but that we'll retain numbers similar to now but over an extended period of time as long as we keep doing what were doing now.
Wait, we're meant to be wearing pants?

Same Lockdown as the last 2 weeks. Non-essential businesses, schools and so on closed. No travelling beyond 2k of home except for essential needs like grocery shopping. And Garda #237; extra powers that were put in place recently to enforce restrictions (such as fines of up to #8364;2,500 and up to six months in prison in worse case scenarios) have been extended to match the lockdown extension.
Yeah, it's all gotten a bit out of hand. This was all kind of funny at first but it devolved pretty quickly. Now everyone is just overreacting and trying to act the victim.
Well, finally shaved the head. And I think I actually prefer it. Plus it's a lot fucking cheaper in the long term.
DLSS 2.0 is what I'm most excited for in the future. If done right it be a huge performance boost for lower to mid level cards.

I'm noticing some are starting to crack a little. Not surprising, it's been 3 weeks or so since the lockdown with a little over 2 more weeks to go before we know what happens next. It's not the majority or anything, just a few. Bunch of Guards up by the GAA breaking up a fairly large group this morning. I was walking the dog and the lads who weren't kids were kicking up a storm. The other night they had to break up a house party. The owner of the local shop was giving out at how some aren't following the social distancing rules in place (only 2 in the store at a time and following the floor guides). Said they had no problem the first week or so following the rules but they're getting lax about the rules as time goes on. I'd say it's still only a small minority but things are bound to slip a little as time goes on.

This lockdown has been the easy part compared to what might come next. At some point restrictions will slowly ease up but how a lot of businesses will function is gonna be tough to figure out. Not to mention if you lost your job during all this it's gonna be tough to find a new job in this current environment. Hell, I had a drivers test coming up just before this all kicked off, so that's been on hold which limits a lot of my future plans. This has all been necessary obviously, but we're in for a tough few months no matter how I look at it and I see no end to that until an actual vaccine arrives that will let us all get back to normal. And that aint happening in 2 weeks to say the least.

Well if theres one pro to all this it's that I've time to binge video games again like I'm a kid. I passed Final Fantasy VII Remake last night, usually that would have lasted me at least 2-3 months but passed it after a little over a week. I see Simon Harris came out saying we cant get complacent over the restrictions just because were keeping it under control right now. Makes sense, I've noticed some are letting things slip, be it chatting with people while not keeping distance, ignoring shop rules and Guards had to crack down on local lads going up to the local GAA. It's been weeks now with another 2 to go, people are bound to crack a little. Unfortunately until we have a real vaccine, things just cant go right back to normal, there'll have to be some restrictions even under the best conditions. Otherwise all this work put in up to now will be lost and were right back to square one. The good weather isnt gonna help either. **Edit:** Think I'll start Persona 5 Royal, probably the only chance I'll have to play a game that huge.
No spoilers, you've still a good bit to go. My full playtrough was hitting 40 hours. I think there's around 17 chapters in total and you should be around chapter 7 or 8.

Apart from the ending being overly complicated and meta, I didn't mind the end result basically being "the story now doesn't have to be 100% the same". That's fine, no issue there with me so far. But the whole Zack multiple timeline stuff has me concerned this is going to get incredibly convoluted on top of a story that is already complicated enough. I was hoping this remake would actually try to simplify and streamline the original story a bit while fleshing it out. I don't see how that can end well or not need a whole wikipedia section trying to explain even the most basic elements of it to understand. We didn't need the whole time ghosts to explain changes either, most people didn't expect a 1 to 1 remake when the first game was just Midgar anyway.

Very, very good overall. Characters feel more fleshed out and if you're a fan of the original there's more than a few scenes that'll make you smile ear to ear. And genuinely funny, goofy moments too. It remembered that the original wasn't always dark and gritty. Not many sidequests. They're pretty basic but don't take much time. Overall, I'd recommend the game. Without any spoilers, the ending is interesting. I'm not crazy about it but I'm not gonna spoil anything.

**ENDING SPOILERS:** Apart from the ending being overly complicated and meta, I didn't mind the end result basically being "the story now doesn't have to be 100% the same". That's fine, no issue there with me so far. Don't see why we needed an in-game story for that since it's a remake not a remaster but whatever. But the whole Zack multiple timeline stuff has me concerned this is going to get incredibly convoluted on top of a story that is already complicated enough. I was hoping this remake would actually try to simplify and streamline the original story a bit while fleshing it out. I don't see how this can end well or not need a whole wikipedia section trying to explain even the most basic elements of it to understand. We didn't need the whole time ghosts to explain changes either, most people didn't expect a 1 to 1 remake when the first game was just Midgar anyway.

Yeah, like right after the first Reno fight at the church. I was genuinely annoyed when they showed up and pulled me out of the scene. A better option is that more Shinra soldiers show up right as Cloud is about to finish Reno, start shooting and Cloud is shielding the gunfire and Aerith says they can run into the back room. Better flow and can lead to a scene of Aerith giving out to Cloud about trying to kill Reno which connects to the scene further back of Tifa being scared of Cloud talking about killing Johnny which can lead to some character development.

Their playtrough of Last of Us had me roll my eyes a few times when Troy would stop any conversation to let everyone know how well acted the current scene is and then go into how deep it is etc. Felt like it happened every 10 minutes. I can't remember what part it is but Troy tried to dramatize the behind the scenes of a part the game cutscene only for Nolan to say he doesn't remember it happening that way as he was on scene that day. Love the guy but he kind of gets a bit self absorbed at times while Nolan is a bit more care free and goofy, doesn't take himself that seriously. I think that's what kind of made Retro Replay work though.
